CT: Podocyte slit diaphragm@Barrier – filters – solutes based on charge and size; Renal blood flow@Renal blood flow (RBF) ≈ 1.1 L/min (~25% of cardiac output); RBF = ΔP / R

AS: Autoregulation@Afferent arteriole – constricts – in response to pressure ↑; Filtration fraction@RPF – filtered fraction – GFR/RPF; GFR – equals – 20% of RPF; Glomerular filtration@Glomerular filtration barrier – filters – plasma water/solutes; Filtration – selective for – size and charge; Mesangial cell contractility@Mesangial cells – alter – filtration surface area; Thin descending limb@Thick ascending limb – exports – solutes via NKCC2; Tubuloglomerular feedback@Macula densa – senses – NaCl; Macula densa – adjusts – afferent tone
CT: Renal vasoconstriction@Sympathetic activity – reduces – renal blood flow (RBF) and glomerular filtration rate (GFR)

AS: Control of Na+ and H2O@Water excretion = GFR × [P]H₂O – H₂O reabsorbed; K⁺ reabsorption (PT, TAL)@Thick ascending limb – reabsorbs – solutes via NKCC2; Mesangial cell contractility@Mesangial cells – alter – filtration surface area; Renin secretion (RAAS)@Macula densa – senses – NaCl， JG cell – releases – renin; Thin ascending limb@Thin ascending limb – reabsorbs – NaCl passively; impermeable – to water; Thin descending limb@Thick ascending limb – exports – solutes via NKCC2; Tubuloglomerular feedback@Macula densa – senses – NaCl; Macula densa – adjusts – afferent tone
CT: H⁺/K⁺ exchange@α-IC cells – secrete – H⁺; α-IC cells – reabsorb – K⁺; Organic Nutrients[VitB&C, Acetate, ketones, Kreb cycle intermediates]@Reabsorption of 100% of filtered organic nutrients in the proximal tubule (PCT); Type A vs. B intercalated cell polarity@α – secrete – H⁺; β – secrete – HCO₃⁻; angiotensin-activated signaling pathway@AT1 mediates classical RAAS effects; AT2 opposes AT1; fluid uptake@Bulk flow of interstitial fluid supports peritubular capillary reabsorption

AS: Control of Na+ and H2O@Water excretion = GFR × [P]H₂O – H₂O reabsorbed; Mg²⁺ reabsorption@TAL – paracellular transport – ions (Na⁺, Mg²⁺, Ca²⁺); Pressure natriuresis@↑ arterial pressure – leads to – ↑ Na⁺ excretion independent of hormones
CT: Aldosterone action@Efferent arteriole – constriction – increases GFR; H⁺ secretion & HCO₃⁻ secretion@α-IC, secretes, H⁺；H⁺-ATPase, transports, H⁺； H⁺/K⁺-ATPase, exchanges, H⁺ and K⁺; H⁺ secretion & HCO₃⁻ secretion@β-IC, secretes, HCO₃⁻; Kidney–lung acid–base synergy@Aldosterone – increases – ENaC activity; Organic Nutrients[VitB&C, Acetate, ketones, Kreb cycle intermediates]@Reabsorption of 100% of filtered organic nutrients in the proximal tubule (PCT); Type A vs. B intercalated cell polarity@α – secrete – H⁺; β – secrete – HCO₃⁻; angiotensin-activated signaling pathway@AT1 mediates classical RAAS effects; AT2 opposes AT1; fluid uptake@Bulk flow of interstitial fluid supports peritubular capillary reabsorption
Kidney–lung acid–base synergy@Aldosterone – increases – ENaC activity; angiotensin-activated signaling pathway@Angiotensinogen → Renin → Ang I → ACE → Ang II
